snippet: Oakland officials have agreed to relinquish power over the city’s police department to a court-appointed director to avert a federal takeover.
abstract: Officials in Oakland, Calif, agree to relinquish power over city’s police department to a court-appointed director to avert a federal takeover; reforms were ordered decade ago to settle police brutality lawsuit, but have not been made.
lead_paragraph: Oakland officials have agreed to relinquish power over the city’s police department to a court-appointed director to avert a federal takeover.

headline.main: California: Deal Reached for Board to Oversee Oakland Police
headline.print_headline: California: Deal Reached For Board To Oversee Oakland Police
